title: Purdue University TTT and Road Race
21st Annual MARIAN MIDWEST CYCLING CLASSIC Criterium
xXx Racing-Athletico Women's Camp
description:
XXX Racing-Athletico Women's Camp
Friday, April 21st, Saturday, April 22nd, and Sunday, April 23dr, 2017
course: Train with Coach Randy Warren in the hills of Central Indiana
registration: Open to XXX Racing-Athletico members only. Got to www.xxxracing.org for registration information.

title: 2017 Major Taylor Racing League Thursday night series
J's Bikes Racing's Gravel Fondue
description:
Gravel Race south of Terre Haute.  Flat and fast.  Or flat and muddy and slow.  Either way - flat.
Gran Fondo style - timed event, but no specific categories.
Visit the world-class Griffin Bike Park while in town for the race.
course: 56-mile and 26-mile options on gravel and dirt roads through southern Vigo County's mine and farmlands.
notes:
No frills.  No big prizes.  Times and placings will be reported to USA Cycling, TrueSport, and posted on our own website at JsBikesRacing.com.

This is a trial event for a bigger race we are planning for the fall.

title: River City Bicycle Classic
description: River City Bicycle Classic - June 17, 2017 - Garvin Park - Evansville, Indiana
course: This road criterium racecourse is a fast 0.7-mile loop around the lake in historic Garvin Park.  The wide-open course features several turns that are ideal for racing and spectating.  Course closed to traffic.
notes: The River City Bicycle Classic is part of the Indiana Kentucky Cycling Criterium Points Series.  For more information, please visit www.inkycycling.com/point-series.html
directions: From I-64 take Exit 25 traveling south on US 41.  Drive 11.8 miles, take the ramp to IN-66 W/Diamond Ave.  Turn right onto east Diamond Ave.  Drive 1.2 miles, turn left onto north Heidelbach Ave. Drive .3 miles to Garvin Park.  Please do not park in the baseball stadium parking lot unless you receive communication from the race director that it is okay to do so.  Look for signs and volunteers indicating race parking.

title: 3rd Annual Team Pursuit Showdown at MTV
Indy Criterium Bicycle Festival strengthened by IU Health
description:
The 8th annual Indy Criterium is sure to challenge the racers and thrill the spectators. Situated in the heart of Downtown Indianapolis, the Indy Crit offers cyclists a unique opportunity to race the city streets that they would rarely ride otherwise. The previous three years have drawn over 600 racers from across the Midwest!!  Be a part of the fun and excitement of Indiana's largest criterium race!

START/FINISH and FESTIVITIES to return to Monument Circle! The Indy Criterium will feature the same popular course with the start/finish line and festivities being held on Monument Circle.  The direction of the course will run clockwise, allowing for a long, sprint finish towards the monument. Riders can expect the same smooth and safe pavement conditions for race day.

The Indy Criterium is an official non-profit 501(c)3 event. All event proceeds benefit Freewheelin' Community Bikes. Over $124,000 has been raised for Freewheelin' through the Indy Criterium! A HUGE thanks to our racers, sponsors and fans!

RACE HIGHLIGHTS: 

 - $6,500 CASH Prize Purse & Primes ($4,500 cash purse & $2,000 cash primes)
 - HUGE sell-out fields
 - Over $5,000 in MERCHANDISE Prizes
 - Midwest Junior Regional Criterium Championship 
 - Podium ceremony on stage for all categories
 - Call-ups for first 20 pre-registered in each category
 - Unique figure-8 course in the heart of the city
 - Neutral Race Support provided by Michael Kubansek - wheels in/wheels out
 - Pre-Registration Contest: 
 - Zipp Carbon Wheelset ($2,100 value)
 - TruTrainer Rollers x 2 ($1,300 value per set)
 - Free swag at Registration table
 - A 2017 INKY Points Series Event

EARLY REGISTRATION CONTEST: Presented by Zipp/SRAM & TruTrainer
Pre-Register for the Indy Crit by June 30, 2017 to be entered to win a set of Zipp carbon wheels or a set of TruTrainer rollers!  Check out our website for more details: http://www.indycrit.org/pre-registration-contest 
   
JUNIORS ONLY EARLY REGISTRATION CONTEST: Presented by TruTrainer
All juniors who pre-register for the Indy Crit by June 30, 2017 to be entered to win a set of TruTrainer bicycle rollers, valued at $1,300!  Check out our website for more details: http://www.indycrit.org/juniors-pre-registration-contest

FESTIVAL HIGHLIGHTS:
 - Food, Beer Garden, Expo Vendors, Team Tent Area
 - Marian University & TruTrainer Pre-Race Warm-Up Tent - Why bring your trainer when you can do your pre-race warm up and cool down here!
 - BMX Stunt Shows
 - Morning Indy Crit Kick-Off Ride
 - PNC Family Fun Ride
 - PNC Kids Races
 - Celebrity race and Handlebar Indy Pedal Pub race
 - PNC Kids Zone Activities
 - Free bike parking at Pedal & Park!
 - Fees: See fee schedule below.  $20/additional race


USAC EVENT RULES: 
Held under USA Cycling permit. All USA Cycling rules apply. Free-lap rule is in effect. Lapped riders may be pulled at the officials discretion. You must present a valid 2017 USA Cycling license at registration to enter any race. Only Category 5 men and Category 5 women may purchase a one-day license for $10 at registration. Promoter reserves the right to shorten, modify, cancel or combine any race or prize list in the event of insufficient entries or bad weather. Junior girls age 15-18 Cat 4 & Cat 1/2/3 riders will be placed in their respective juniors races and also in the overall category but will be paid from the prize purse of the category in which they registered (juniors), not the overall prize purse.  If a Junior Girl, age 15-18 Cat 4/5 & Cat 1/2/3, wishes to be considered for the overall Women's prize purse(s) in their respective categories, they must register as a "Woman", not as a "Junior". All winners must be present to receive prizes/awards. Day of race registration opens at 8:00am and closes 30 minutes before the start of each race. $20 fee for each additional race. Pre-registration closes at 1159pm EST on 7/5/17. $10 late fee applies for race day registration. Helmets required. No refunds.

* Master 40+ Cat 1/2/3 & Master 50+ Cat 1/2/3 shall be scored separately.
** Master 40+ Cat 4/5 & Master 50+ Cat 4/5 shall be scored separately.
course:
COURSE DESCRIPTION: 
 - 0.95 mile closed course / wide lanes / flat
 - Unique figure-8 course design
 - Race on the bricks of Monument Circle
directions:
DIRECTIONS: https://goo.gl/maps/QncBEPrYY6L2

FREE PARKING: Free parking available to racers at: "CENTRAL PARK” PARKING GARAGE 301 N. ILLINOIS ST. INDIANAPOLIS, IN 46204

title: 2017 SATURDAY SPRINT SPECIAL #2 - State Sprint Tournament
2017 Team Heroes & Pendleton Falls Park Crit
2017 USAC Indiana State Time Trial Championship
description: 2017 Indiana State Time Trail Championship.  Cash payouts to 40K overall top 5 fastest times for men; top 3 for women.  Championship medals to eligible winners of each category.
course: Out and back OPEN course on Indiana State road 42.  Start in Monrovia and head west on SR 42.  40K turn-around at Eminence school.  This is the same course as the Monrovia Time Trial Series.
notes: Parking and registration/check-in at Monrovia High School.  Start is 1/2 mile away at the intersection of Baltimore and Main Streets (SR 42).
directions: IN 70 to exit 59.  South on state road 39 to Monrovia High School.

title: Indy Cross 3 - Indiana Cyclocross State Championship
Tour de Cure Time Trial, Powered by LoKe Bicycles
description: The Indiana Tour de Cure's Competitive Ride Route is new in 2017! The registration fee includes entry to the Team Time Trial, which features 30 teams made up of 4 cyclists (per team) competing in the Open or Collegiate divisions. Each team will be released in 60 second intervals and will complete 4 laps (10 miles) on the track. All Team Time Trial registrants will have access to all Tour de Cure event activities, including track access prior to the Time Trial.
course: The race course is on the famed Indianapolis Motor Speedway.  It is a automobile race surface of high quality with slight banking in the corners.  Each lap is 2 1/2 miles.
registration:
Online Registration can be found at: 
All participants are required to meet the $200 fundraising minimum. The Team Time Trial is presented by Deloitte and powered by Loke Bicycles. The Trial is also sanctioned by USA Cycling.
notes:
We will utilize Merckx style rules for this race.  There will be two award classes for each division: Top Fundraiser and Best Time. The Top Fundraiser Award will be a combination of overall time and money raised for the Indiana Tour de Cure. 1 second will be deducted from the time for every $100 raised by team competitors over the $200 minimum per rider. All award winners will receive recognition in a post Time Trial award. 

    The “Best Time” award will be given to the fastest team to complete the Time Trial. 
    Awards for first, second and third place will be given for the “Best Time” category. The “Best Time” award recipient will be recognized as the USA Cycling event winner.

Schedule for the Day:

    7:00 am- Registration open for 50K, 75K and 100 Mile  opens, Bike Pit Stop, Sponsor Expo
    8:15 am- Opening ceremonies
    8:30 am – 50K, 75K and 100 Mile rides begin
    10:00 am –  Family Fun Ride begins, Kids Zone
    **2:00 pm – Team Time Trial**
    4:00 pm- Track closes 

Rules for the race are as follows:
All USA Cycling rules apply. 
A CPSC approved helmet is required. 
No drafting is allowed. 
-Starting order will be chosen by random selection.  Each team shall report to the starter at least three minutes before their scheduled starting time.  Riders will start at the yard of bricks in the Pit area of the track and will take all laps on the track, finishing at the yard of bricks start/finish line.  
-Riders are responsible to be at the start line on time. Riders who miss their start time will be given instruction for re-start at the discretion of race officials the following options:
1) Continue with the originally assigned start time. Rider will start late and in effect have a time penalty.
2) Receive a new assigned start time. Rider will receive an accurate time but won’t appear in the results/standings.
In the timing notes at the bottom of the results, rider elapsed time will appear based on the new assigned time.
Timers will only accept a revised start time affecting results/standings from the chief referee in case of a starting line mishap, or from the event promoter in case of an event mishap.
-All riders must start with one foot on the ground and should not be restrained nor pushed. All teams must start in the same manner.
-Riders start 60 seconds apart. 4 laps must be completed; there will be no time allowance for less or more than 4 laps. Riders should go to the outside (right side) of upcoming team to pass.  No team shall take pace behind another team closer than 25 meters (80 feet) ahead, or 2 meters (7 feet).
-Finish time will be taken from the fourth riders front wheel.

The Eddy Mercks Category, for men and women, is for the traditionalist rider on a regular road bike:
- No skin suit No aero helmet, no helmet cover
- No aero shoes, no shoe covers 
-No aero handlebars
- No frame tube can be elongated more than a 2 to 1 ratio
- No wheels with a rim over 60mm deep


A valid USA Cycling license is required to compete in this event. Purchase annual licenses on-line at www.usacycling.org.
We can sell you a one day license ($10) if you don’t have an annual license; payment MUST be included with your entry form. A signed Athlete Release Form will be available at check in day of event.
Results will be formally posted after all riders have completed for a 15 minute protest period. Riders may question any results with the USA Cycling Chief Referee. At the end of the protest period all results are FINAL and the award ceremony will begin. No changes to results will be made after the protest period ends and we leave the event. It is the participant’s responsibility to validate their time prior to leaving the event.
directions:
Directions to the Indianapolis Motor Speedway: 

The Indianapolis Motor Speedway Ticket Office and Credential Offices are located in the Main Administration Building at 4790 W. 16th Street, Indianapolis, IN 46222, just east of the roundabout at Crawfordsville Road and 16th Street. There are multiple ways of reaching the Indianapolis Motor Speedway. IMS features entrances and exits across all directions around the facility.  Additional information can be found at:  http://www.indianapolismotorspeedway.com/at-the-track/directions-and-zones/directions-to-ims

title: Marian Fall MTB Festival - MWCCC Regionals
Major Taylor 'Cross Cup 2017 - UCI & OVCX Weekend
Region Riot Cross
course: 1.4 mile spectator-friendly course through the woods at the Lake County Fairgrounds in Crown Point, Indiana.
registration: Race day registration opens at 7:00am and closes 30 minutes before each race. Online registration closes the Thursday night prior to the race. Register online at usacycling.org Day-Of fees are CASH only! Preregistration will close when the fields are at the 100 rider limit. Day of registration incurs a $5 late fee. All riders must sign a USAC rider release form and event waiver. Additional races are only $10. Events will be scored separately. Single Speed requirements: One usable gear and two working brakes. Event is held rain/snow/shine. Call ups are based on Cross Results ranking then by order of registration.
notes: All races will be held under USAC permit. Riders who have never held and annual USAC license will be required to purchase a 1-day license for $10. Renew your annual license online at usacycling.org. Annual licenses will not be sold at the event. Helmets must be worn at all times while on a bicycle!
directions:
REGION RIOT CROSS
Lake County Fairgrounds
889 S Court St, Crown Point, IN 46307
Sunday, November 26th 2017
